item.title: mark add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "There is no such thing as inner peace. There is only nervousness and death." -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: mark add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "I never change, I simply become more myself." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: mark add a quote by David Lynch
item.description: "My cow is not pretty, but it is pretty to me." -- David Lynch

item.title: mark add a quote by Anton LaVey
item.description: "It’s too bad that stupidity isn’t painful." -- Anton LaVey

item.title: mark add a quote by Alfred Hitchcock
item.description: "There is no terror in the bang, only in the anticipation of it." -- Alfred Hitchcock

item.title: mark add a quote by Djuna Barnes
item.description: "A man is whole only when he takes into account his shadow." -- Djuna Barnes

item.title: mark add a quote by Robert Aickman
item.description: "The first step towards mastering time is always to make time meaningless" -- Robert Aickman

item.title: mark add a quote by Angela Carter
item.description: "Reading a book is like re-writing it for yourself. You bring to a novel, anything you read, all your experience of the world. You bring your history and you read it in your own terms." -- Angela Carter

item.title: mark add a quote by Jack Vance
item.description: "Notice this rent in my garment; I am at a loss to explain its presence! I am even more puzzled by the existence of the universe." -- Jack Vance

item.title: mark add a quote by Iain M. Banks
item.description: "Fuck every cause that ends in murder and children crying." -- Iain M. Banks

item.title: mark add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "Everybody is special. Everybody. Everybody is a hero, a lover, a fool, a villain. Everybody. Everybody has their story to tell." -- Alan Moore

item.title: mark add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "No single thing abides; and all things are fucked up." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: mark add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "I've got death inside me. It's just a question of whether or not I can outlive it." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: mark add a quote by John Crowley
item.description: "The further in you go, the bigger it gets." -- John Crowley

item.title: mark add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "I'm for open-mindedness and tolerance. I'm against any form of fanaticism, fundamentalism or zealotry, and this certainty of 'We have the truth.' The truth is far too large and complex. Nobody has the truth." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: mark add a quote by Edmund White
item.description: "I'm sorry," Billy says, "but I felt it was too organized. I like ellipses and teeny jottings and spontaneous poems and particularly all those devices like long lists of melancholy things." -- Edmund White

item.title: mark add a quote by Manny Rayner
item.description: "There's nothing wrong with giving up all your principles for a suitable financial reward. It is indeed the basis of our society." -- Manny Rayner

item.title: mark add a quote by Brett J. Talley
item.description: "I don't understand exactly what's going on, but Goodreads shouldn't be deleting reviews, period. People are smart enough to look at them on their own and make up their mind, and deleting reviews undermines the integrity of the site." -- Brett J. Talley

item.title: mark add a quote by Manny Rayner
item.description:
"Many people have been protesting against what they describe as censorship on Goodreads. I disgree. In fact, I would like to say that I welcome the efforts that Goodreads management is making to improve the deplorably low quality of reviewing on this site.
Please, though, just give me clearer guidelines. I want to know how to use my writing to optimize Amazon sales, especially those of sensitive self-published authors. This is a matter of vital importance to me, and outweighs any possible considerations of making my reviews interesting, truthful, creative or entertaining." -- Manny Rayner
